column4: omfg I love linux so much, Able to retrieve my file ( I hope) and it doesnt make my system chugg while doing it!
dd if=/mnt/cdrom-1/File.avi of=/home/smo/file.avi conv=noerror is that the right syntax??
ack! it did not work, It copied the file but the file had a poop anyways. Now I have a file in my home folder that was created using root, how do i delete it in command?
sudo rm filename
yes
see  man chmod  and man chown
yw :)
yes
will it run at normal speed or slower because I switched?
won't make any significant difference - X is alreadsy runnning on vt 7
Thanks so much for answering all my newbie questions
you're welcome :)
in *nix silence is golden :)
if there's a probem it spits out an error
so say if I hit ctrl + c half way through will that corrupt my HD?
i haven't followed the whole conversation - Ctrl-C will usually stop the process so it depends what the command is doing whether it is safe or not
actually it will usually end the process - stopping it temporarily would be Ctrl-Z
google   "process control linux " for more info and/or read man signal
bedtime reading -> http://tiswww.case.edu/php/chet/bash/bashref.html#SEC87  heheh
use cp -a or cp -R
dd is serious low level stuff - don't use it for routine copying
